snippet: Hussam Al Roustom, his wife and their two children are among 1,682 Syrian refugees who settled in the United States in the last year through a public-private partnership.
abstract: Hussam Al Roustom and his family are among 1,682 Syrian refugees admitted to United States since October 2014, and their journey offers window into what lays in store for 10,000 Syrians Pres Obama has pledged to accept into country; family now resides in Jersey City, NJ; federal government has formal partnership with large network of nine aid groups with ties to local communities that aids in settling newly arrived refugees.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Hussam Al Roustom, his wife and their two children are among 1,682 Syrian refugees who settled in the United States in the last year through a public-private partnership.

headline.print_headline: For Some Syrian Refugees, Life in U.S. Has Already Begun
headline.main: Syrian Refugees in Jersey City Are Among Few to Start New Life in U.S.
